Package automaton

Class Automaton

java.lang.Object
automaton.Automaton
public class Automaton
extends java.lang.Object
Automaton class, allowing the testing of inputs through instances of Automaton(java.lang.String, automaton.State, java.util.List<automaton.State>)

  • Constructor Details

    • Automaton

      public Automaton​(java.lang.String name, State s0, java.util.List<State> sf)
      Public constructor of an Automaton(java.lang.String, automaton.State, java.util.List<automaton.State>). Creates an Automaton(java.lang.String, automaton.State, java.util.List<automaton.State>) based on states and transitions. Instances of Automaton(java.lang.String, automaton.State, java.util.List<automaton.State>) allow to run multiple inputs through an finite-state automaton. In order to create an instance of an Automaton(java.lang.String, automaton.State, java.util.List<automaton.State>), it is recommended to use AutomatonAPI's builders and parsers.
      Parameters:
      name - name of an Automaton(java.lang.String, automaton.State, java.util.List<automaton.State>)
      s0 - initial state of an Automaton(java.lang.String, automaton.State, java.util.List<automaton.State>)
      sf - final states of an Automaton(java.lang.String, automaton.State, java.util.List<automaton.State>)
      See Also:
      Parser, AutomatonBuilder

  • Method Details

    • accepts

      public boolean accepts​(java.lang.String input)
      Runs an input through an Automaton(java.lang.String, automaton.State, java.util.List<automaton.State>). Navigates states character by character to reach to an end state, which should be a final state of an Automaton(java.lang.String, automaton.State, java.util.List<automaton.State>).
      Parameters:
      input - string running through Automaton(java.lang.String, automaton.State, java.util.List<automaton.State>) states
      Returns:
      a boolean depending on whether the input has properly made it through the Automaton(java.lang.String, automaton.State, java.util.List<automaton.State>) or not.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      The outcome of this method can be used to manipulate finite-state automata as .dot files.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      a String formed as a .dot file.

    • export

      public boolean export​(java.lang.String path)
      Exports an instance of Automaton(java.lang.String, automaton.State, java.util.List<automaton.State>) as a file. File extension should be specified in the path This method will not override an elready existing file !
      Parameters:
      path - path to the file to write in
      Returns:
      true if an Automaton(java.lang.String, automaton.State, java.util.List<automaton.State>) properly is exported. Returns false otherwise

    • export

      public boolean export​(java.lang.String path, boolean override)
      Exports an instance of Automaton(java.lang.String, automaton.State, java.util.List<automaton.State>) as a file. File extension should be specified in the path
      Parameters:
      path - path to the file to write in
      override - whether this method should override an already existing file or not. Attention : No confirmation is needed
      Returns:
      true if an Automaton(java.lang.String, automaton.State, java.util.List<automaton.State>) properly is exported. Returns false otherwise
